io.realm.sync.permissions

Class RealmPrivileges

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.realm.sync.permissions.RealmPrivileges

  • public final class RealmPrivileges
extends Object
    This object combines all privileges granted on the Realm by all Roles which the current User is a member of into the final privileges which will be enforced by the server. The privilege calculation is done locally using cached data, and inherently may be stale. It is possible that this method may indicate that an operation is permitted but the server will still reject it if permission is revoked before the changes have been integrated on the server. If this happens, the server will automatically revoke any illegal operations. Non-synchronized Realms always have permission to perform all operations.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RealmPrivileges

        public RealmPrivileges(long privileges)

    • Method Detail

      • canRead

        public boolean canRead()
        Returns whether or not can see this Realm. If true, the user is allowed to read all objects and classes from the Realm. If false, the Realm will appear completely empty (including having no schema), effectively making it inaccessible.
        Returns:
        true if the user can see the Realm, false if not.

      • canUpdate

        public boolean canUpdate()
        Returns whether or not the user can update Realm objects. If true, the user is allowed to update properties on all objects in the Realm. This does not include updating permissions nor creating or deleting objects. If false, the Realm is effectively read-only.

        This property also in part control if schema updates are possible. If this returns false, the user is not allowed to update the schema, if true, schema updates are allowed if canModifySchema() also returns true.

        Returns:
        true if the user can update this Realm, false if not.

      • canSetPermissions

        public boolean canSetPermissions()
        Returns whether or not the user can change RealmPermissions. See this class for further information.
        Returns:
        true if the user can modify the RealmPermissions object, false if not.
        See Also:
        RealmPermissions

      • canModifySchema

        public boolean canModifySchema()
        Returns whether or not the user can modify the schema of the given resource.
        1. Realm: If true the user is allowed to create classes in the Realm.
        2. Class: If true, the user is allowed to add properties to the given class.
        3. Object: Not applicable.
        Returns:
        true if the user can modify the schema of the given resource, false if not.
